0.title: Wikimedia Foundation stops accepting crypto donations after eight years
0.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), which hosts Wikipedia, has announced that it will no longer accept donations in cryptocurrency. The WMF said it will also close its BitPay account, "which will remove our ability to directly accept cryptocurrency as a method of donating". The decision comes eight years after the organisation first began accepting donations in Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ether.

1.title: I played Mohsin in the nets, then didn't want to face him: KL Rahul
1.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul called their pacer Mohsin Khan "brilliant" as the 23-year-old picked four wickets against DC, helping them win by six runs. Rahul added, "I played Mohsin in the nets a month ago, [then] didn't want to face him...He was sharp, he's scary at times in the nets. It's not just the pace, he has a good brain."

2.title: Maha CM inaugurates replica of Shivaji Maharaj's fort in Mumbai
2.article_body: A replica of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's fort near Mumbai international airport was inaugurated by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday. A statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was also installed at replica fort. Notably, Thackeray didn't touch on political issues while speaking at the function and said that he would address them at a political rally on May 14 in Mumbai.

3.title: PMC to now offer staff free housing in gardens' residential areas
3.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to provide free accommodation to Garden Department staff who want to stay in the residential areas in its gardens. The order, however, stated that the staff would have to pay for their water and electricity charges. The PMC had not been paying house rent allowance to employees staying in its gardens so far.

4.title: Idli seller held for possessing whale puke, worth ₹5 crore, in Mumbai
4.article_body: An Idli seller was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly possessing 2 kg of whale vomit worth ₹5 crore. The accused, identified as Shendu Raman Shrinivasan, had taken a loan for his idli shop and wanted to pay off his debts through the money from the sale of whale vomit, the officials of the Aarey Police Station said.

5.title: Salim was a good actor, skin phobia came in way of his success: Shyam Benegal
5.article_body: Filmmaker Shyam Benegal said that late actor Salim Ghouse was a good actor but "skin phobia" came in the way of his success in commercial Hindi cinema. "We suffer from a massive colour prejudice. We boast of plurality in skin pigmentation. But when it comes down to actual facts we suffer from a massive skin phobia," he added.

6.title: I was banned from the film industry after #MeToo movement: Kangana
6.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently revealed in 'Lock Upp' that she was banned in the film industry after she came out in support of the #MeToo movement. "The women who had come forward with accusations, they have all vanished from the face of the planet," she added. "I was banned from the industry, while the women I supported disappeared," Kangana said.

7.title: Alcaraz doesn't have to look at me anymore, he's a star already: Nadal
7.article_body: Rafael Nadal said tennis player Carlos Alcaraz is already a star. "He doesn't have to look at me anymore. He's a star already. He's doing amazing things," Nadal stated. Alcaraz recently won the Barcelona Open after beating Pablo Carreño Busta. "Happy about being a fan of tennis that we're going to have an amazing player for...a long time," Nadal added.

8.title: Ex-IAS officer Tarun Kapoor appointed Advisor to PM Narendra Modi
8.article_body: Former Petroleum Secretary Tarun Kapoor has been appointed as the Advisor to PM Narendra Modi, the government said on Monday. The 1987-batch retired IAS officer has been appointed for a period of two years from the joining date, the order said. Hari Ranjan Rao and Atish Chandra have been appointed as Additional Secretaries in the PM's office.

9.title: Dhoni had so much support towards the end of his career, they took him to WC: Yuvraj
9.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh stated that several players including him, Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir and Virender Sehwag didn't get support from team management towards the end of their careers. He added, "Look at MS Dhoni. He had so much support from Virat Kohli and Ravi Shastri...They took him to World Cup. He went on to play 350 games."

10.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' earns ₹20 cr in pre-booking in India
10.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Elizabeth Olsen, has reportedly earned ₹20 crore in advance ticket bookings in India. As per reports, it has surpassed the advance booking numbers of 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Directed by Sam Raimi, 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is set to release on May 6.

11.title: Hope my stardom & fan following will help me bag me some films: Karan
11.article_body: During a press conference, actor Karan Kundrra said that although he is dubbed as "the king of TRPs and star on television, he has a lot to achieve". "Even on the web show 'Lock Upp'...we had 5.2 million people watching live at 1 am," he said. "I hope my stardom and fan following help me bag some films," he added.

12.title: Kohli still comes to the gym with child-like enthusiasm: RCB fitness coach Basu
12.article_body: RCB's strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu has revealed that Virat Kohli still comes to the gym "like a child". "The enthusiasm hasn't come down even one per cent. In fact, it has only gone up," he stated. "Virat is mainly...trying to build muscle mass. T20 also requires a lot of explosive energy; force production is a byproduct," added Basu.

13.title: If batters attack him, he'll attack them back: Ojha on RR's Chahal
13.article_body: Praising Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said the more one challenges the RR leg-spinner, the better he comes out. "If batters attack him, he'll not go on the defensive, he'll attack them back," he added. In RR's last match against KKR, Chahal conceded 17 runs in his first over before claiming a hat-trick. He finished with figures of 5/40.

14.title: Kejriwal must visit RSS shakhas to learn about nationalism: BJP leader
14.article_body: BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh invited Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to visit the RSS headquarters to "learn about nationalism". "Nationalism must be in our heart and mind. We know how nationalist he is. He raises questions about surgical strikes and opposes 'The Kashmir Files'. What about the riots that happened under his government in Delhi and Patiala," he said.

15.title: Odisha to build 1000 bridge-cum-dams to boost drinking water sources
15.article_body: The Odisha government to build 1000 more bridge-cum-weirs (low dams) across the state, senior officials said. These low dams, which will be constructed within three years, will function to boost the state's drinking water and irrigation sources, officials said. Notably, the state government have earlier built such structures and their impact was found positive, senior officials said.

16.title: SRH coach Steyn takes CSK captain Dhoni's autograph, pic goes viral
16.article_body: A picture of SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowling coach Dale Steyn taking Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni's autograph after their IPL 2022 match on Sunday has gone viral. "GOAT recognises GOAT," a fan commented. "Steyn might be taking it for someone," another fan wrote. "Biggest legends in world cricket," another tweet read.

17.title: MyPillow's millionaire CEO rejoins Twitter, banned again after 3.5 hours
17.article_body: American firm MyPillow's multi-millionaire CEO Mike Lindell was banned from Twitter on Sunday, 3.5 hours after making a return to the platform. Lindell, a supporter of ex-US President Donald Trump, was banned from Twitter in January 2021 for spreading misinformation about the 2020 election. Twitter said Lindell's account was permanently suspended for violating the platform's rules on ban evasion.

18.title: Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine hits 5-month high
18.article_body: The Russian gas supply to Europe through Ukraine via the Slovakian border point of Velke Kapusany hit a five-month record high on Monday, according to Slovakian operator TSO Eustream. Daily nominations for gas deliveries stood over 9.9 lakh megawatt hours, the highest since November 30. This comes despite calls for boycott of Russian fuel in Europe over Ukraine war.

19.title: 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters put up in Mumbai ahead of Raj Thackeray's visit
19.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena has put up 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters in Mumbai, appealing to people to join party chief Raj Thackeray on his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 5. Amid the ongoing loudspeaker row, Thackeray on Sunday warned that if they aren't taken down, then 'Hanuman Chalisa' would be played with double volume from May 4.

20.title: Wanting to frame people from village, UP man gets friend to rape wife
20.article_body: In a bid to frame some people from his village, a man allegedly got a friend to rape his wife in Uttar Pradesh. The man took his 22-year-old wife to a forest on Sunday. His friend also came to forest and raped his wife twice. The man then called police and told them two people had sexually assaulted his wife.

21.title: Which are the world's top 15 places for long-term remote workers as per a research?
21.article_body: Lisbon is the best location for long-term remote workers, research by real estate services company Savills, listed on the London Stock Exchange, said. Lisbon is followed by Miami, Dubai, Algarve, Barbados, Barcelona, Dubrovnik, Saint Lucia, Malta, Antigua, Mauritius, Côte d'Azur, Cyprus, Tuscany and The Bahamas. "They offer favourable climates year-round and a high quality of life," Savills said.

22.title: WhatsApp banned more than 18 lakh Indian accounts in March 2022
22.article_body: WhatsApp banned 18.05 lakh accounts in India in March 2022, the platform said in its latest monthly compliance report. The accounts were banned on the basis of complaints received from users and through WhatsApp's own mechanism to prevent and detect violations. WhatsApp also detailed the user complaints it received during the month and the corresponding action it took against them.

23.title: Vicky, Kiara and Bhumi's 'Govinda Naam Mera' release postponed: Report
23.article_body: The release dates of Vicky Kaushal, Kiara Advani and Bhumi Pednekar's 'Govinda Naam Mera' and Sidharth Malhotra and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Mission Majnu' have been postponed. "Some...work is remaining, and there's also an event Hollywood film, 'Jurassic World', up for release, so [they're] in no hurry to bring their...projects," report stated. Both the films were slated to release on June 10.

24.title: I would choose to marry her 'all over again': Bill Gates on ex-wife Melinda
24.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said that he would choose to marry ex-wife Melinda "all over again". "From my point of view it was a great marriage. I wouldn't have changed it. You know, I wouldn't choose to marry someone else," he added. The pair announced their decision to divorce in May 2021 after nearly 30 years of marriage.

25.title: Fresh case against Mehul Choksi for cheating IFCI of ₹22 cr during 2014-2018: CBI
25.article_body: The CBI said it has filed a fresh case against fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi and his Gitanjali Gems for allegedly cheating government-run IFCI Limited of ₹22 crore between 2014 and 2018. Choksi allegedly approached IFCI seeking financial support for Gitanjali Gems and got it to sanction a ₹25 crore corporate loan in 2016. The company allegedly defaulted on loan repayments.

26.title: US First Lady to meet Ukrainian refugees during Romania, Slovakia trip
26.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden will visit Romania and Slovakia from May 5-9 and meet Ukrainian refugees, along with US service members and embassy personnel during her trip, her office confirmed on Monday. Jill will also meet humanitarian workers and teachers working with displaced Ukrainian children. Her trip follows US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to Kyiv.

27.title: Electricity issues to be resolved within 10 days: Haryana CM
27.article_body: Speaking about the power crisis in Haryana, CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said the power-related issues will be resolved within next 10 days. "We've already provided 24-hour electricity to 5,600 villages and 800 are next…The power demand has increased by 50% as compared to the last year and of this, 30% has been fulfilled by state government," Khattar added.

28.title: Will give PKR50,000 to anyone who rips off ex-minister Rashid's wig: Pak PM's aide
28.article_body: Special assistant to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, Hanif Abbasi, has said that anyone who rips off and brings former Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid's wig will be rewarded PKR50,000. Abbasi said former Prime Minister Imran Khan, Rashid and his nephew were involved in planning the incident in Saudi Arabia's Masjid-e-Nabawi in which the Sharif delegation was insulted.

29.title: Daryl Mitchell hasn't quite shown the player that he is: Vettori
29.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has said Daryl Mitchell could be the all-rounder RR are looking for if he's given a few more chances in the tournament. "Daryl hasn't quite shown the player that he is," added Vettori. Daryl played in RR's last two games and scored 17(20) and 16(24) without taking wickets in his two overs.

30.title: 12 arrested from B'luru in Karnataka police recruitment exam scam
30.article_body: As many as 12 people from Bengaluru have been arrested by the Crime Investigation Department in connection with last year's police sub-inspector recruitment exam in Karnataka. These people are said to have cleared the recruitment examination. A fresh FIR has listed 22 candidates from Bengaluru as accused in the scam.

31.title: B'luru underpass floods due to rain; disrupts traffic for 3 hrs
31.article_body: Traffic was disrupted for almost three hours after the Okalipuram underpass got waterlogged due to heavy rainfall in Bengaluru on Sunday. At least 46 electric polls either fell or were damaged and a transformer failed in the district amid the heavy downpour. A traffic police station also took to Twitter to urge people to be safe while driving.

32.title: Live hand grenade recovered from Army jawan's bag at Srinagar airport
32.article_body: A live hand grenade was allegedly recovered from an Army jawan's baggage during screening at the Srinagar airport on Monday, officials said. The jawan, a resident of Tamil Nadu, has been detained, the officials added. The jawan was scheduled to travel to Chennai via Delhi by an Indigo flight.

33.title: Katrina is a great influence in my life; I learn from her every day: Vicky
33.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal said that his wife, actress Katrina Kaif has been a great influence in his life. "I'm very fortunate to have found a life partner in her because she's an extremely wise, intelligent, and compassionate person," he added. "I learn a lot from her every single day," he said. Vicky got married to Katrina in December last year.

34.title: Israel calls Russian minister's Hitler comment 'anti-semitic', seeks apology
34.article_body: Israel's Foreign Ministry on Monday denounced Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's "Hitler had Jewish blood" remark, terming it 'anti-semitic' and demanded an apology from Moscow. The ministry also summoned Russian Ambassador for "tough talk". Lavrov in an interview drew comparison between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Nazi leader Adolf Hitler over latter's alleged Jewish roots.

35.title: Audi, Porsche have decided to join Formula 1: Volkswagen CEO
35.article_body: Volkswagen's premium brands Audi and Porsche have decided to join Formula One, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess confirmed on Monday. Porsche's preparations are a little more concrete, Diess, speaking on YouTube, added. It comes after Reuters reported in March that Audi is ready to offer $556.30 million for British luxury sports carmaker McLaren as a means to enter.

36.title: 9-year-old girl raped by uncle at a brick kiln in UP's Bijnor
36.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was raped by her uncle (18) in Shivala Kalan village in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the accused works as a labourer at a brick kiln site. Notably, the incident took place when the victim’s parents had gone to work at the same brick kiln site, police said.

37.title: Musk is visionary, he'll make Twitter open to diverse views: Zoho CEO
37.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told ET Now that Elon Musk is a "great visionary" who will make Twitter more open to diverse viewpoints. Vembu said, "[Debates] have been particularly one-sided on Twitter...it is similar to the Cultural Revolution period of China." He added that both Musk and he are against the "cancel culture" rampant on Twitter.

38.title: The board, not any individual investor, suspended the CEO: Zilingo
38.article_body: Singapore-based startup Zilingo said the decision to suspend its Indian-origin Co-founder and CEO Ankiti Bose was taken jointly by the board and not by any individual investor. "Following her suspension...Bose brought to the board’s attention, for the first time, certain harassment-related allegations," Zilingo said. No investor was made aware of Bose's claims prior to her suspension, it added.

39.title: Australian man admits he pushed gay American off cliff in 1988
39.article_body: A 51-year-old Australian man, Scott White, admitted that he pushed a 27-year-old gay American mathematician Scott Johnson off a Sydney cliff which killed him in 1988. The prosecutors have described it as a gay hate crime. "I pushed a bloke. He went over the edge," White was heard saying in a recorded police interview which was played in a court.

40.title: Direct investment in equities hit 6-month low in March
40.article_body: Direct retail investment in the equity market through the National Stock Exchange stood at ₹7,100 crore in March, the lowest inflow in more than six months, data showed. The net inflows from retail investors were down 49% month-on-month in March.  The dip came despite addition of over 9 million dematerialised accounts in the March quarter, data further revealed.

41.title: Vijay Babu steps down from Malayalam artistes' body after sexual assault case
41.article_body: Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu, who has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman, has decided to step down from the executive committee of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA). "Vijay Babu...[said]...he didn't want to bring disgrace to the organisation," AMMA said. Vijay appeared in a Facebook live session recently and claimed innocence, saying he's the "real victim".

42.title: Buttler starts afresh every game, hasn't taken his form for granted: Nick Knight
42.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Nick Knight has praised RR opener Jos Buttler, who's currently the highest run-scorer in IPL 2022, stating that the 31-year-old is "starting afresh" in every game in the tournament. "Buttler hasn't taken his form for granted at all. He's giving himself a few balls to get in and then [he] plays those big shots," added Nick.

43.title: Film took 3 yrs to complete as Aamir had signed other films: Sarfarosh director
43.article_body: 'Sarfarosh' director John Matthew Matthan said the film took three years to complete because Aamir Khan had signed three films and his dates kept getting pushed. "This was one of the...reasons why Aamir decided to not work in multiple films at a time," he added. "Every time I'd be geared up to shoot, the schedule would get pushed," he said.

44.title: Thieves & robbers made ₹303 crore in Mumbai in last 4 yrs: Report
44.article_body: Thieves and robbers in Mumbai made ₹303.79 crore in the last four years, according to The Indian Express. Valuables and cash collectively worth ₹69.13 crore were lost to thieves and robbers in 2021 alone. Notably, the police were able to recover ₹163.24 crore of the ₹460.48 crore in valuables and cash stolen or robbed by criminals during the same period.

45.title: Shilpa shares video of her working out on a bus, fan calls her 'inspirational'
45.article_body: Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share a video of her working out in an empty bus on her way to her flight at an airport. "Monday motivation on the go...only because the bus was empty...Squeezed in some pull-ups, push-ups, and lunges on my way back home," she wrote. Several people praised Shilpa, with one writing, "You're truly an inspiration."

46.title: Which are the five fastest balls in IPL 2022 so far?
46.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik has bowled the fastest delivery in IPL 2022 so far. He clocked 154 kmph twice in SRH's match against CSK on Sunday. GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson's 153.9-kmph delivery against CSK is the third-fastest delivery of IPL 2022. It is followed by Umran's 153.3 and 153.1-kmph deliveries against GT and CSK, respectively.

47.title: U'khand to introduce Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana in schools: Minister
47.article_body: Uttarakhand will include Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Vedas in the school curriculum, state Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said on Monday. He added that Uttarakhand is the first state to implement the National Education Policy (NEP). Apart from introducing Gita in schools, the history of Uttarakhand will also be taught to students, the minister added.

48.title: Pant guiding Kuldeep just the way MSD did: Kuldeep's childhood coach
48.article_body: Kuldeep Yadav's childhood coach Kapil Dev Pandey said Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant is doing what MS Dhoni used to do with Kuldeep. "Pant is guiding Kuldeep the way Dhoni did...He is guiding him from behind the stumps," he stated. Kuldeep has taken 17 wickets in nine matches so far. "They're on the same page about most things," Kapil added.

49.title: We aren't going in game focussing on just Buttler: Russell ahead of KKR-RR
49.article_body: Ahead of KKR-RR match in IPL 2022, KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said the franchise aren't solely focussing on current leading-scorer Jos Buttler. "Because if it's not his [Buttler] day, we can't get him out cheaply, celebrate big and pretend that we have won the game," he added. He further said Buttler "hurt" them in their last encounter, scoring 103(61).

50.title: Rampant corruption in Haryana, people forced to pay bribes: AAP leader
50.article_body: AAP leader Sushil Gupta stated that rampant corruption is going on in all departments in Haryana and people are being "forced" to pay bribes to get their works done. "Corruption, crime and unemployment have been soaring in the state," Gupta added. He further said that corruption is rampant in Haryana with the "support" of ministers.

51.title: Punjab announces recruitment to 26,454 posts, approves ration delivery scheme
51.article_body: The Punjab Cabinet on Monday gave its approval for recruitment to 26,454 posts in various departments in the state. The Cabinet has also approved one MLA-one pension and door-to-door ration delivery schemes, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced. He added that compensation of ₹41.8 crore has been approved for soft crop failure in Sri Muktsar Sahib.

52.title: Mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions wins award in UK
52.article_body: A wearable mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions in real-time is one of the four winners of the inaugural Terra Carta Design Lab competition in the UK. Created by UK-based design group Zelp, the mask captures methane with each burp. A catalyst oxidises the gas and releases it into the atmosphere as carbon dioxide and water vapour.

53.title: To-be captain Jadeja should've been involved in mega auction: Irfan
53.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MS Dhoni leaving his CSK captaincy for Ravindra Jadeja two days before the start of IPL 2022 was a surprise. "Because if Dhoni had made up his mind to leave the captaincy, to-be captain Jadeja should've been involved in...[mega] auction," he added. "If Dhoni's exit was a last-moment decision...means Jadeja wasn't involved in the auction," he said.

54.title: South Korea reopens embassy in Ukraine’s Kyiv
54.article_body: South Korea on Monday reopened its embassy in Kyiv, which was shut following Russia's attack on Ukraine. The Kyiv embassy was evacuated and two temporary liaison offices were established in Ukrainian cities of Lviv and Chernivtsi after the war started. The South Korean Foreign Ministry said it intends to work with the local government to protect its citizens in Ukraine.

55.title: 2 sisters, Zomato agent die as car hits divider in Delhi, flips 4-5 times
55.article_body: A speeding car rammed into a motorbike and crashed into iron railing of a road divider in Delhi on Sunday, before flipping four to five times. Two sisters aged 17 and 19 and a food delivery agent wearing Zomato t-shirt was killed in incident. Eyewitnesses said sisters fell out of rear windows of car when it was flipping over.

56.title: You'll waste life on court dates: Mumbai Mayor to MNS on loudspeaker issue
56.article_body: MNS workers should not take the law into their hands, "otherwise their life will be wasted attending court dates", said Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar in response to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker ultimatum. "Loudspeakers will be removed from temples and mosques...No one, including Muslims, opposed Hanuman Chalisa," she said. Loudspeakers must be used as per noise pollution rules, she added.

57.title: Sundar re-injured his hand vs CSK, it had an impact on our bowling: Tom Moody
57.article_body: SRH coach Tom Moody confirmed that all-rounder Washington Sundar, who had earlier missed three games due to split webbing in his bowling hand, suffered an injury on the same hand against CSK. "It's not injured to the point that it [needs] re-stitching...but, it wasn't in a state where he could bowl," stated Moody. "It really had an impact," he added.

58.title: I wish to start my own venture with my money, won't go to investors: Ashneer
58.article_body: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover at a recent event said, "I wish to start my own venture with my own money and make it profitable." Grover termed his tussle with the fintech startup as a "badly fought corporate battle". He also said that he does not want to go back to the investors again when starting his new venture.

59.title: Police took my sister to a room, I later found her hanging: UP gangster's daughter
59.article_body: After elder daughter of gangster Kanhaiya Yadav was found dead following a police raid at his house in UP, his younger daughter said, "Two women police personnel & 8-10 male personnel took my sister to a room and beat her. They left after half an hour." "I entered the room & saw her hanging from ceiling fan," she added.

60.title: Conspiracy against me designed by PMO: Jignesh Mevani
60.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani on Monday said it was a "pre-planned conspiracy" to "destroy" him. "You're using a woman to lodge FIR against me. This is a conspiracy designed by the PMO in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections," Mevani stated. Earlier, an Assam court granted bail to Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman.

61.title: So what if Zelenskyy is Jewish, Hitler also had Jewish blood: Lavrov
61.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on being questioned about his country's President Vladimir Putin's call to "denazify" Ukraine, replied, "So what if [Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy] is Jewish? The fact does not negate the Nazi elements in Ukraine." "I believe that Hitler also had Jewish blood," he said. Lavrov said this during an interview with Italian news channel Zona Bianca.

62.title: Balasaheb told Advani 'if Modi is removed, you'll lose Guj' after 2002 riots: Uddhav
62.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has revealed that after the 2002 post-Godhra riots in Gujarat, his late father Balasaheb Thackeray supported PM Narendra Modi (then the state's CM). There was a demand to remove PM Modi as Gujarat CM then, Uddhav said, adding, "Balasaheb told (LK) Advani...'Modi shouldn't be touched. If Modi is removed, (the BJP) will lose Gujarat'."

63.title: Debates on Uniform Civil Code will bear constructive outcome: Naqvi
63.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said on Monday that holding debates on Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will bear constructive outcome for the country. "UCC is not being introduced for the first time in the world, our constitution-makers said that we must move towards adopting [it]," he added. Naqvi's comments come amid proposed implementation of UCC by Uttarakhand, among other states.

64.title: No ban on selling meat in Bengaluru tomorrow: Civic body on rumours
64.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has denied rumours that there will be a ban on sale of meat in the city on Tuesday, when Eid will be celebrated, since the festival clashed with Basava Jayanti. A senior BBMP official said the Urban Development Board hasn't marked Basava Jayanti as a day when there is a moratorium on selling meat.

65.title: Markaz Nizamuddin mosque to stay open beyond Ramzan for 1st time since 2020
65.article_body: For the first time since 2020, the mosque at the Markaz Nizamuddin has been granted permission by the Delhi High Court to open beyond Ramzan as well. Notably, this is the first time since March 2020 that such permission has been granted to the Masjid Bangley Wali. The mosque will remain open till October 14, advocate Wajeeh Shafiq said.

66.title: After Taare Zameen Par's success, I was bullied in school: Darsheel
66.article_body: Actor Darsheel Safary revealed after the success of his film, 'Taare Zameen Par', he had to face bullying in school where he was surrounded [by kids] and his clothes were pulled. "I had to take...half-day to save myself," Darsheel said. He added that recently several people came up to him and were under the impression that he had quit acting.

67.title: Salman is quite excited about No Entry 2, it's an extremely funny film: Anees
67.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that Salman Khan is quite excited about 'No Entry 2', a sequel to his 2005 film. "The scripting of 'No Entry 2' is complete and I've narrated it to Salman, who loved the film...It's a nicely written and an extremely funny film," he added. Anil Kapoor and Fardeen Khan will also return for the sequel.

68.title: Finch doesn't want to play left-arm seamers at all: Piyush Chawla
68.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has criticised KKR for changing their openers frequently in the ongoing IPL season. Chawla suggested that KKR should open with Ajinkya Rahane and Venkatesh Iyer, stating, "Aaron Finch doesn't want to play left-arm seamers at all". KKR, who are eighth on the IPL points table, will play their 10th game in the tournament against RR on Monday.

69.title: Mumbai airport to remain shut for maintenance for 6 hours on May 10
69.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) will remain shut from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm on May 10 for pre-monsoon maintenance work, a statement from CSMIA said. The airport has advised all passengers to check the May 10 flight schedules with their respective airlines to avoid inconvenience. "The runway closure is a yearly practice," CSMIA's statement said.

70.title: 502 metres long Surkanda Devi Temple ropeway inaugurated in U'khand
70.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday inaugurated the ropeway service from Kaddukhal to the Surkanda Devi temple in the state's Tehri district. Reports said that the ropeway is 502 metres long and can ferry up to 500 people every hour. Dhami said that the ropeway would create more jobs and benefit the tourism sector in the state.

71.title: WWII Victory Day on May 9 won’t impact Ukraine operation: Russia
71.article_body: Russia will commemorate Victory Day, which marks the end of World War II, on May 9 in a solemn manner and it won't impact the military operation in Ukraine, said Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. "Our soldiers won't base their actions on a specific date," he said on being asked if the day would mark a turning point in Ukraine conflict.

72.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.83% in April, Haryana tops list: Report
72.article_body: The unemployment rate in India rose to 7.83% in April 2022 from 7.60% in March 2022, according to data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). The highest unemployment rate of 34.5% was recorded in Haryana. It's followed by 28.8% in Rajasthan, 21.1% in Bihar, 15.6% in Jammu & Kashmir, 15.5% in Goa and 14.6% in Tripura.

73.title: Gave Jadeja full control after 2 matches, spoon-feeding doesn't really help: Dhoni
73.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy in IPL 2022, CSK skipper MS Dhoni suggested he gave full control to Jadeja after the latter's first two matches as captain. Dhoni added that he took care of fielding angles and gave more information to Jadeja in the first two matches, but stopped doing that thereafter. "Spoon-feeding doesn’t really help the captain," Dhoni stated.

74.title: Tiger ripped his pants during Heropanti 2 shoot; Thank God we had more: Ahmed
74.article_body: 'Heropanti 2' director Ahmed Khan said that actor Tiger Shroff ripped his pants and suits during the film's shoot. "Even if we gave Tiger an eight-way stretching elastic material, it would wear off. The suit and pants would tear in rehearsals itself. Thank God we had more ready." "Tiger [had] gone all full swing, splits and back-flips," Ahmed said.

75.title: Maximum temp likely to fall by 2-4°C over Northwest, Central India during next 3 days: IMD
75.article_body: The IMD has said that maximum temperature is likely to fall by 2-4°C over most parts of Northwest and Central India during the next three days. It added that the temperature will likely rise after three days. "No significant change in maximum temperatures over Gujarat and Maharashtra during next 2 days and rise by about 2°C thereafter," it stated.

76.title: Don't know what captain, management are thinking: RP Singh on KKR
76.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has criticised KKR over changes in their batting order in IPL 2022. "Venkatesh Iyer had been moved from top to the middle-order. He's back [as] opener...now. Nitish Rana has also been moved up and down the order. No batter is getting a settled position," explained Singh. KKR have lost six of their nine games so far.

77.title: 'Prithviraj' is my dream project, lived with this story for 18 yrs: Director
77.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the writer-director of the upcoming film 'Prithviraj' starring Akshay Kumar, has said he lived with this story for 18 years before deciding to make it into a film with Aditya Chopra. "[It's] my dream project," he said, adding, "There's no Samrat like Prithviraj in our history...and I hope our film is a fitting tribute to his valour."

78.title: Balasaheb told Advani that Modi shouldn’t be removed as Guj CM: Uddhav
78.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray has said that Balasaheb had told LK Advani to "not remove Narendra Modi from the post of Gujarat Chief Minister". "Balasaheb told Advani ji then that Modi should not be touched. If Modi was removed, (the BJP) will lose Gujarat and that Hindutva will suffer because of it," he added.

79.title: Neobank startup Open becomes India's 100th unicorn with new funding
79.article_body: Neobank startup Open on Monday announced that it has entered the unicorn club with a new funding round that values it at $1 billion. With this, the Bengaluru-headquartered startup has become India's 100th unicorn. The Series D funding round was led by IIFL and saw participation from existing investors Tiger Global, Temasek and 3one4 Capital, Open said.

80.title: Neutralised Russian agents were planning to attack passenger plane: Ukraine
80.article_body: Ukrainian Parliament on Sunday claimed that its security forces neutralised Russian "saboteurs" who were planning a terrorist attack in which they'd shoot down a passenger plane over Russia or Belarus. The attackers were going to "unjustifiably" accuse Ukraine and its allies of the attack, it alleged. "The enemy sabotage group consisted of two dual citizens and an accomplice," it said.

81.title: Methane emissions from cows' burps observed from space for 1st time; pic released
81.article_body: Methane emissions burped up by cows have been observed from space for the first time, environmental data company GHGSat said as it released a satellite picture. The company's analysis confirmed that the emissions came from a cattle feedlot in California's Joaquin Valley. As cows digest their food, they release methane, mostly through their gassy burps.

82.title: LSG mentor Gambhir hurls abuse in joy & celebrates aggressively against DC, video viral
82.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir hurling an abuse in joy and celebrating aggressively during their win against DC in IPL 2022 on Sunday. "The Gautam Gambhir we all know," a fan tweeted reacting to the video. LSG defeated DC by six runs and are currently placed second on the points table.

83.title: PM's misgovernance spanning 8 yrs is a case study: Rahul on inflation, power crisis
83.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi's "misgovernance" spanning eight years is a case study. "Power crisis, jobs crisis, farmer crisis, inflation crisis - PM Modi's eight-years of misgovernance is a case study on how to ruin what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies," Gandhi tweeted.

84.title: All parties should work together in this direction: Raghav Chadha on coal shortage
84.article_body: Moving apart from politics, all parties should work together towards the coal shortage issue, AAP leader Raghav Chadha said. "Not just one or two states but 16 states of the country are facing a huge coal shortage and electricity crisis," Chadha added. "Coal, Railway and Power Ministries should work under PM's leadership," Chadha stated.

85.title: AAP has Khalistani mentality people: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil
85.article_body: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil a "non-Gujarati", the latter responded by alleging that AAP has members with a "Khalistani mentality". "Giving responsibility in his party to people with Khalistani mentality and believing that making a demand for Khalistan is a constitutional right, Arvind Kejriwal is a threat to security of the country," Paatil tweeted.

86.title: You're my icon: Girl after PM Modi asks why she made his portrait during Germany visit
86.article_body: A video showing PM Narendra Modi interacting with a girl who made his portrait during his Germany visit has surfaced online. The PM asked the girl, "Why did you make this?" to which she replied, "Because you are my icon." The girl can be heard telling the PM that she spent an hour drawing the portrait.

87.title: My goal is to approach H'wood sooner, don't want to regret it later: Tara
87.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria said that her goal is to approach Hollywood sooner. She added, "I have had conversations with people there as well...but...the focus right now is here." "I do feel like it would be really nice to approach that sooner rather than later because I don't want to regret it much later," Tara said.

88.title: Truly blessed: Hema shares pic with Dharmendra on 42nd wedding anniversary
88.article_body: Actress-politician Hema Malini took to Instagram on Monday to share a picture with Dharmendra on the occasion of their 42nd wedding anniversary. "Our wedding anniversary today. I thank God for all these years of happiness, our darling children and grandchildren, our well-wishers everywhere! I feel truly blessed," she wrote. Several people posted congratulatory comments on the post.

89.title: HC stays Kumar Vishwas' arrest over remarks against Kejriwal
89.article_body: Former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas, who has been booked for making alleged inflammatory statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, was granted protection from arrest by the Punjab and Haryana High Court. Vishwas had moved the court demanding quashing of the FIR filed against him by Punjab Police. Vishwas had reportedly accused Kejriwal of supporting separatists ahead of Punjab elections.

90.title: Russian oligarch 'forced to sell stake' after he criticised war
90.article_body: Russian oligarch, Oleg Tinkov, told The New York Times that he was forced to sell 35% stake in TCS Group Holdings, a company he founded, after he criticised Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I couldn't discuss the price. It was like a hostage," he said. Earlier, Tinkov had said, "I don't see a single beneficiary of this insane war (in Ukraine)."

91.title: Priority is to ensure high standards of operational preparedness: Army Chief
91.article_body: Army Chief General Manoj Pande said his top priority in this position will be to maintain high standards of operational preparedness to meet the present and future challenges in all kinds of combat. "In terms of capability development and force modernisation, my effort would be to leverage new technologies through indigenisation and self-reliance," he added.

92.title: Won't give barren land without water to our next generation: Haryana CM
92.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday inaugurated the Amrit Sarovar scheme which aims to develop and rejuvenate 75 water bodies in the state. "Water is the core of a healthy land...We would not like to give barren land without water to our next generation," Khattar said. He further said that every drop of water will be saved and used.

93.title: Amber Heard fires her entire PR team over 'bad headlines' amid defamation trial: Reports
93.article_body: Actress Amber Heard fired her entire PR team after being "upset" by "bad headlines" amid the defamation trial brought by her ex-husband Johnny Depp. Heard is "frustrated with her story not being told effectively", a source said. Depp has sued Amber for $50 million, claiming she defamed him in an op-ed piece, wherein she spoke about surviving domestic abuse.

94.title: Minor girl playing near working mom dies as bus hits her in Gurugram
94.article_body: A 10-year-old girl, who was playing near roadside next to where her mother was rummaging through garbage, died as a bus hit her in Gurugram. Her father said that a bus that was taking a U-turn hit his daughter while negotiating the turn. He said the driver was driving negligently and at high speed. The girl had suffered multiple injuries.

95.title: Boy sings patriotic song for PM Modi as he arrives in Germany; video goes viral
95.article_body: A viral video shows an Indian-origin boy singing a patriotic song for PM Narendra Modi on his arrival in Germany. PM Modi is on a three-day, three-country visit to Europe. "My visit to Europe comes at a time when the region faces many challenges. I intend to strengthen the spirit of cooperation with our European partners," he said.

96.title: 116 trainees complete special course at INS Shivaji in Pune
96.article_body: As many as 116 trainees - 112 from Indian Navy, three from Indian Coast Guard and one from Tanzania - completed the 33rd Merged Artificer Apprentice Course (MAAC) at INS Shivaji in Pune. The completion ceremony of the course that spanned 96 weeks was held on Saturday. Trainee Prashant C bagged the first rank in the overall order of merit.

97.title: PM Modi snaps his fingers as Indian-origin boy sings a patriotic song in Germany
97.article_body: A viral video shows PM Narendra Modi snapping his fingers as an Indian-origin boy sings a patriotic song on his arrival in Germany. PM is on a three-day, three-country visit to Europe. "My visit to Europe comes at a time when the region faces many challenges. I intend to strengthen the spirit of cooperation with our European partners," he said.

98.title: Salman offers Shehnaaz a huge amount for Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali: Reports
98.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Shehnaaz will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. According to reports, Shehnaaz has been offered an incredible fee by Salman. Salman, reportedly, has allowed Shehnaaz to choose a fee of her will. Due to his fondness towards Shehnaaz, he approached her to be a part of the movie, reports added.

99.title: Dalit family stopped from using platform for kin's last rites in MP
99.article_body: Three people were arrested after a Dalit family was allegedly stopped from using the platform at a crematorium for the last rites of their deceased family member in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, an official said on Monday. Later, the family performed the last rites on the land near the platform instead. A video of the incident had surfaced online.

100.title: 4 including 2 Aligarh Muslim University workers die as truck hits them in UP
100.article_body: Four people, including two employees of the Aligarh Muslim University, were killed after a drunk driver mowed them down with his truck in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. A 12-year-old boy, on way to deliver food to his uncle and a 65-year-old labourer having tea at stall were killed in incident. The driver allegedly hit 12 people and rammed into several stalls.

101.title: Take a single and go to non-striker's end: Gavaskar to batters facing Umran
101.article_body: On being asked what batters should do to tackle SRH pacer Umran Malik, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar jokingly said, "Take a single and go to the non-striker's end." Umran bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, clocking 154 kmph against CSK on Sunday. In the ongoing IPL season, he has picked 15 wickets in nine games.

102.title: Forest fire spreads, surrounds Shimla orphanage; 93 girls rescued
102.article_body: As many as 93 girls were rescued after a forest fire spread and surrounded a government-run orphanage in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. Twenty children who were aged below six were shifted to a women's working hostel, while the rest were sent to another orphanage. The orphanage's superintendent said that locals helped in the evacuation as the fire tenders had got delayed.

103.title: I've moved on, want to tell my ex 'Don't take limelight from me': Ali Mercchant
103.article_body: Actor Ali Mercchant said that it was tough and hurtful for him to be mocked and being told that he was in 'Lock Upp' because of his ex Sara Khan. "I don't have the habit of lying...Now that I am out of the show...I just want to tell...my ex- don't take the limelight from me," Ali added.

104.title: Time to go to people, the real masters; will start from Bihar: Prashant Kishor
104.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday tweeted, "My quest to be a meaningful participant in democracy and help shape pro-people policy led to a 10-year rollercoaster ride!" "As I turn the page, time to go to the Real Masters, THE PEOPLE, to better understand the issues," he wrote. "Will start from Bihar," he added.

105.title: I wake up daily, feel I can't breathe: Local man on Bhalswa landfill
105.article_body: Mohan Thakur, resident of outer-north Delhi's Swami Shraddhanand Colony, next to Bhalswa landfill, that caught fire on April 26, said he wakes up every day and feels like he can't breathe. "I'm used to poisonous air...my body still reacts to it...My eyes burn," he said. Thakur's wife said the landfill catches fire during summers and it goes on for days.

106.title: MS Dhoni gets angry at pacer Mukesh over wide ball, video goes viral
106.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing CSK captain MS Dhoni getting angry at fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary for bowling a wide in the last over against SRH. In the video, Dhoni can be seen gesturing towards Mukesh to "use his brain" and not bowl an extra. Choudhary registered figures of 4-0-46-4 in the match.

107.title: Pregnant woman kidnapped from station in front of family; gangraped by 3 in Andhra
107.article_body: A pregnant woman, waiting with her husband and three children at a railway station, was abducted by two men and a minor, and allegedly gang-raped near the station in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. The woman's husband, who was beaten up, tried to get the help of the railway police but could not find any official at the station.

108.title: I'm much more than my face & body; want people to see me for that: Zareen
108.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan said that she hopes people give her a chance and not judge her on the basis of the work that she has done. "[People] have only seen me look like a diva and not really doing much," she added. "I am much more than my face and body and I want people to see that," Zareen said.

109.title: Odisha man kills his 3 kids, dumps bodies in well after fight with wife
109.article_body: A tribal man allegedly killed his three children and dumped their bodies in a well in Odisha’s Sundargarh on Saturday, police said. The man purportedly had a fight with his wife. "After he pulled an axe to attack me, I ran out of the house to save my life. I don't know how he killed my children," his wife said.

110.title: 2 sloth bears rescued from 'madaris' in Jharkhand’s Bokaro
110.article_body: Two fully-grown sloth bears were rescued from 'madaris', who use animals for street performances, in Jharkhand's Bokaro following BJP MP Maneka Gandhi's intervention. The forest department officials found the bears tied to trees when they reached Parasbani village. "The 'madaris', who might have already got information about us, escaped from the spot," said an animal welfare group member.

111.title: NSUI protests, seeks permission for Rahul's visit to Hyd's Osmania University
111.article_body: NSUI members held a protest at the Hyderabad's Osmania University seeking permission for Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit on May 7. An NSUI member alleged that despite the state government's order, the university's Vice-Chancellor isn't giving permission to hold the event inside the campus. Notably, several protesting NSUI members were detained by the police on Sunday.

112.title: Fire at Iraq oil refinery after missile attack; 4 missiles defused
112.article_body: A fire broke out at a main tank in an oil refinery in Erbil in Iraq's Kurdistan after six missiles landed near the plant on Sunday, authorities and security forces said. The security forces added that following this, they found a launchpad and four missiles in Nineveh Plain and defused them. Iraqi PM Mustafa al-Kadhimi called it a "cowardly attack".

113.title: Putin to undergo cancer surgery, ex-spy chief to 'take control' of Russia: Reports
113.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will reportedly undergo surgery for cancer and has nominated former KGB counterintelligence officer Nikolai Patrushev to "take control" of Russia while he is incapacitated. The surgery had been scheduled for the second half of April but was delayed, reports said. Patrushev, 70, is regarded as a key architect of the Ukrainian war strategy.

114.title: Tollywood actor Gopichand suffers injury while shooting in Mysore
114.article_body: Tollywood actor Gopichand suffered an injury while shooting for an action sequence in Mysore. As per reports, the shooting of the yet-untitled film was halted for a while. According to director Sriwass' statement, Gopichand's leg slipped while shooting a scene. "He is doing completely fine. I request fans and friends not to worry about this incident," the statement further read.

115.title: No one can be forced to get COVID vaccine, govt must release adverse effects data: SC
115.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said that no individual can be forced to get a COVID-19 vaccine. The apex court added that the current vaccine policy "can't be said to be unreasonable". The Supreme Court also directed the Indian government to make public the data on adverse effects of COVID-19 vaccination.

116.title: OTT has reintroduced me to the audience: 'Gullak' actress Geetanjali
116.article_body: Actress Geetanjali Kulkarni, who was a part of web shows 'Gullak' and 'Aarya', has said OTT has reintroduced her to the audience. "I did independent films before OTT came but the kind of content OTT showcases is very different and reaches all over the world," she added. Geetanjali further said OTT gives freedom to viewers to choose their content.

117.title: I don't believe in form, I believe in starting from zero in every game: Ruturaj
117.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, who scored his second 50-plus score in the ongoing IPL season on Sunday, has said that he doesn't believe in form and believes in starting from zero in every game. "Irrespective of what you scored in the last game you have to start from zero...[this] is what has helped," he added. Gaikwad scored 99(57) against SRH.

118.title: Anil shares old pic of wife Sunita with Neetu & Krishna Raj Kapoor, fans react
118.article_body: Anil Kapoor on Sunday shared an old picture featuring his wife Sunita Kapoor, actress Neetu Kapoor and the latter's mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor. "Mrs Krishna Raj Kapoor, Mrs Neetu Rishi Kapoor and my wife Sunita #throwbackmemories," he captioned the picture. Reacting to Anil's post, a fan wrote, "Sunita looks like Sonam Kapoor," while another wrote, "Old is gold."

119.title: Will bring back old pension scheme if we win 2023 polls: Kamal Nath
119.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath has said that the old pension scheme will be reintroduced if the party wins the state Assembly polls in 2023. "The old pension scheme for government employees will be implemented like how other states ruled by our party have done," Nath said while speaking at a Madhya Pradesh Shikshak Congress' event.

120.title: Mumbai woman pays for insurance policy from 2015-2020, loses ₹40 lakh
120.article_body: A 61-year-old woman in Mumbai lost ₹40 lakh after a fraudster posing as executive from Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) India, in 2015, told the woman she had earned ₹1.70 lakh on her LIC policy number and that she will get money only after she takes policy worth ₹40 lakh. The woman paid ₹39.66 lakh between May 2015 and July 2020.

121.title: Govt issues health advisory amid intense heatwave, lists dos and don'ts
121.article_body: The government has issued a health advisory amid intense heatwave. Listing dos and don'ts, the government urged citizens to keep themselves hydrated and stay indoors as much as possible. It urged people to wear lightweight cotton clothes and avoid going out. Avoid cooking during peak hours and do not go out barefoot, the government further stated.

122.title: Which batters have been dismissed on 99 in IPL history?
122.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad was dismissed for 99(57) against SRH on Sunday. The 25-year-old right-handed batter became the fifth player to be dismissed on 99 in IPL history. RCB's Virat Kohli had become the first batter to get out on 99 in IPL in 2013. Other batters are Prithvi Shaw (2019), Ishan Kishan (2020) and Chris Gayle (2020).

123.title: Gangster's daughter found dead after police raid in UP; locals say she was thrashed
123.article_body: Protests erupted after elder daughter of gangster Kanhaiya Yadav was found dead following a police raid at his house in Chandauli district of Uttar Pradesh. Locals alleged that she was thrashed by a police officer. The younger daughter of the gangster was also allegedly thrashed and has suffered serious injuries, Chandauli District Magistrate Sanjeev Singh said.

124.title: Video from SpiceJet flight caught in severe turbulence surfaces as 14 injured
124.article_body: A video from the Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet flight that encountered severe turbulence during descent has surfaced online. Several cups, bottles, packages can be seen scattered all across the floor of the plane in the video. The SpiceJet Boeing B737 aircraft was landed safely, however, around 14 passengers were injured after cabin luggage fell on them.

125.title: Joint firefighting exercise 'AGNI DAMAN-22' conducted in Pune
125.article_body: A combined firefighting exercise named 'AGNI DAMAN-22' was conducted in Pune on Saturday, in which forces from agencies such as NDRF, SDRF, PMRDA and other fire departments participated. A total of 35 firefighting columns including 12 from civil agencies participated, said a statement. "Drills and procedures, including swift response strategy against all types of fire, were rehearsed," it added.

126.title: Farmer apprehended with suspected narcotics near border in Amritsar
126.article_body: The BSF apprehended a farmer with two packets of suspected narcotics weighing approximately 1.020 kg near the International Border in Amritsar on Sunday. "Alert BSF troops apprehended the farmer while he was trying to conceal suspicious narcotic packets when he had gone ahead of the fence for farming," BSF said in a statement.

127.title: Man given anti-rabies vaccine instead of COVID-19 in UP; probe on
127.article_body: A man was allegedly administered an anti-rabies vaccine by accident instead of the coronavirus vaccine at a health centre in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, officials said on Sunday. Following this, the district's Chief Medical Officer (CMO) ordered an inquiry. The CMO said that there was "no health hazard" and the vaccine would serve as a "precautionary dose against rabies".

128.title: Gangubai took the win: Ira shares note post watching Alia's Gangubai Kathiawadi
128.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter, Ira Khan, took to Instagram to share her thoughts after watching 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Sharing a poster of the film, Ira wrote, "You can develop a fierce will to change the wrong around you because of the trauma you experienced...'Gangubai' took the win. She felt genuine gratitude, pride and joy from what she did manage to achieve."

129.title: Auto driver, friend held for raping two Class 11 Dalit girls in Gujarat
129.article_body: An autorickshaw driver and his friend were arrested for allegedly abducting and raping two Dalit girls in the Keshod town of Gujarat's Junagadh district. The two victims, who are cousins, were on their way to write their Class 11 annual exams when the incident took place, police said. Notably, the two accused were known to the victims.

130.title: Declared ‘persona non grata’, Belgian diplomats leave Russia
130.article_body: Several employees of the Belgian Embassy in Moscow left Russia after being declared 'persona non grata', according to reports. "12 embassy employees against whom this measure was taken have already returned to Belgium," a Belgian government spokesperson said. The diplomats and their families were flown out in Belgian military aircraft due to absence of regular flights between the two countries.

131.title: Free entertainment: Uddhav in apparent reference to Raj's speeches
131.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, in an apparent reference to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speeches, on Sunday said, "Theatres and cinema halls were shut due to pandemic. So, if one is getting entertained for free, why shouldn't he/she enjoy it?" This comes amid the loudspeaker row in the state. Uddhav also alleged that BJP deceived his father, the late Bal Thackeray.

132.title: BJP creating artificial issues to divide country: Congress' Abhishek Singhvi
132.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said that the BJP is creating "artificial issues" like the hijab and national language issues to divide the country. "BJP is fishing in troubled waters…they want to divide, scare, provoke and antagonise people," Singhvi added. "They draw you into the debate because it suits them...Don't fight on their terms," he stated.

133.title: Need to change mindset of people to check crimes against women: NCW Chairperson
133.article_body: There is a need to bring a change in the mindset of people to put a check on crimes against women, especially incidents of rape and molestation, said NCW Chairperson Rekha Sharma. "It's wrong to blame the dressing of a woman for her rape...There is a need to change the mindset of men," Sharma added.

134.title: Man kills aunt after fight over fencing around papaya sapling in Bihar
134.article_body: A man stabbed his aunt to death following a fight between her and his mother over fencing around a papaya sapling that his aunt had planted in Bihar. The deceased's daughter said that the accused's mother objected to the fencing around the plant, after which, two got into quarrel. The accused then assaulted the victim and stabbed her multiple times.

135.title: Working to prevent a nuclear war: Russia
135.article_body: Amid its conflict with Ukraine, Russia said that it is working to prevent a nuclear war. "The western media misrepresent the Russian threats. Russia has never interrupted efforts to reach agreements that guarantee that a nuclear war never develops," said Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. He added that Russia has built ultrasonic weapons to counter a possible attack from the West.

136.title: Gaikwad becomes joint-fastest Indian to score 1,000 IPL runs, equals Sachin's record
136.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad has become the joint-fastest Indian to score 1,000 runs in IPL. The 25-year-old batter took 31 innings to reach the 1,000-run mark, equalling former Mumbai Indians batter Sachin Tendulkar's record. Sachin and Gaikwad are followed by Suresh Raina (34 innings), Rishabh Pant (35 innings) and Devdutt Padikkal (35 innings).

137.title: 1 dead, 18 hospitalised after eating 'rotten' shawarma in Kerala
137.article_body: A schoolgirl died and 18 other students were hospitalised on Sunday after allegedly eating "rotten" shawarma at a food stall in Kerala's Kasargod. The food stall has been sealed and the police have taken the cook into custody. District Medical Officer AV Ramdas said that more cases are expected and doctors and nurses were asked to be present.

138.title: Dhoni never tells beforehand what to do, he does his work on the field: Ojha
138.article_body: After CSK defeated SRH to register their third win from nine games in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha praised MS Dhoni's captaincy, stating, "Dhoni does most of the work on the ground. He does not tell beforehand what to do to the players." Dhoni returned as CSK captain after Ravindra Jadeja stepped down from the position.

139.title: Dearness Allowance of govt employees increased by 5% in Chhattisgarh
139.article_body: Chhattisgarh government has increased the Dearness Allowance of government employees by 5%. This will be applicable from May 1. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel had taken to Twitter to make the announcement. The dearness allowance of state government employees was 17% and has now reached 22% after the increment.

140.title: India reports 3,157 COVID-19 cases, 2,723 recoveries in last 24 hours
140.article_body: India reported 3,157 COVID-19 cases and 2,723 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,324 COVID-19 cases and 2,876 recoveries. Active cases in India stand at 19,500, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,869.

141.title: Dharmendra shares video after being discharged, says 'I suffered a big muscle pull'
141.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra took to Instagram to share a video after being discharged from the hospital. "Friends, don't overdo things. I did it and I suffered a big muscle pull in the back," he said. "I was in the hospital for two-four days. It was difficult. Anyway, I am back with your good wishes and [god's] blessings," he added.

142.title: Woman offers job to matrimonial match sent by father in B'luru; chat with father viral
142.article_body: A woman has shared screenshot of a chat with her father after she offered a job at her Bengaluru-based start-up to a matrimonial match sent by him. "You cannot hire people from matrimonial sites. What to tell his father now?" her father wrote. "Seven years of fintech experience is great and we are hiring," she replied.

143.title: Gujarat Police to get underwater remote-operated vehicles for rescue ops
143.article_body: In an attempt towards police modernisation, Gujarat Police will acquire underwater remote-operated vehicles (ROV) to carry out rescue operations and other functions. According to the Gujarat Police, the ROV is equipped with a 4k Ultra HD camera and can enter 200 metres into the water. An ROV weighs around 8-10 kilograms and can be operated with a remote, police said.

144.title: BJP fooled innocent Bal Thackeray in guise of Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
144.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said BJP fooled his 'innocent' father, the late Bal Thackeray, in the guise of Hindutva. "I am not going to get fooled because I've seen their tactics," Uddhav added. Speaking about the loudspeaker issue he said, "I don't give importance to this new player of Hindutva. Sometimes he (Raj Thackeray) plays Marathi card and sometimes Hindutva."

145.title: Keep AC on in buses while ferrying students, Gurugram schools told
145.article_body: Amid the prevailing heatwave conditions, the Gurugram administration has directed the schools to ensure that their buses must have air conditioning (AC) on while ferrying students. "We have compiled a list of 500 schools, which are providing transport facilities. We have formed four teams, which will conduct surprise checks to ensure the school buses are following norms," said Deputy Commissioner.

146.title: SRK, Kajol to reunite for a cameo in Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani...': Reports
146.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol Devgan can reportedly reunite for Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' which features Alia Bhatt and Ranveer Singh in lead roles. According to reports, Kajol and Shah Rukh might have a cameo in the film. It's yet to be decided whether the appearance will be for a song or a scene, reports added.

147.title: Bill responds after being accused of inappropriate behaviour on film's set
147.article_body: Veteran Hollywood actor Bill Murray has acknowledged that his behaviour on the set of 'Being Mortal' led to a complaint from a woman and the suspension of filming of his latest movie. "I had a difference of opinion with a woman I'm working with. I did something I thought was funny, and it wasn't taken that way," Bill said.

148.title: Rajasthan's 'Miyan ka Bada' railway station's name changed to 'Mahesh Nagar halt'
148.article_body: Rajasthan's 'Miyan ka Bada' railway station will now officially be known as 'Mahesh Nagar halt'. An official name changing ceremony was held in the Barmer district's Balotra area on Saturday. "It is a long process. Both the Central government and state government give their nod and then the railway station's name changes," Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said.

149.title: Dad messages Aamir Khan, he guided me for projects after 'Taare..' : Darsheel
149.article_body: Actor Darsheel Safary said that his father has been in touch with his 'Taare Zameen Par' co-star Aamir Khan. He also said that Aamir sometimes sends him his blessings and that the actor has guided him on projects after 'Taare Zameen Par'. "He has given me his blessings and his agreements that 'Darsheel, you should do this project'," he added.

150.title: We showed a lot of fight but were unlucky: Williamson on loss vs CSK
150.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said they were "unlucky at times" during their match against CSK, which they lost by 13 runs. "When anyone gets over 200, it'll always be a challenge chasing it down. [But] I thought we responded well to it," he added. Chasing CSK's 202-run total, SRH managed to score 189/6 in 20 overs.

151.title: Pune police dog bows on top of vehicle at parade; video surfaces
151.article_body: Pune City Police on Sunday shared a video of K9 squad dog 'Jack' bowing on the bonnet of a vehicle during the 1st May Parade to mark the formation of Maharashtra. The video shows the dog bowing while the two police personnel salute. "Thank you 'Jack' for joining your human team members for 1st May Parade...Perfect as always!" police said.

152.title: 5 arrested for running over man in Noida road rage; video surfaces
152.article_body: Five persons were arrested for allegedly running over a man in a suspected road rage case near the Mahamaya Flyover on Noida-Greater Noida Expressway on Saturday. The 28-year-old victim is undergoing treatment for brain haemorrhage at Kailash Hospital's ICU. A video of the incident surfaced which showed a man being flung in the air after being hit by a car.

153.title: Prithvi Shaw breaches IPL Code of Conduct, fined 25% of match fee
153.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) opener Prithvi Shaw has been reprimanded and fined 25% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team’s match against Lucknow Super Giants at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Shaw admitted to the Level 1 offence under Article 2.2 of IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction, the IPL said.

154.title: 4-yr-old boy takes mother's car for ride; Dutch police call him 'new Max Verstappen'
154.article_body: A four-year-old boy took mother's car for a drive in the Netherlands and crashed it into two parked cars before leaving the scene bare feet. Bystanders called police after spotting him walking down the street alone in the cold. No one was hurt in the incident, with police saying on Instagram they had discovered a "new Max Verstappen".

155.title: B'luru reports less than 100 new COVID-19 cases after 4 days at 93
155.article_body: The number of coronavirus cases recorded in the past 24 hours in Bengaluru fell below 100 after four consecutive days with 93 cases on Sunday, according to official data. The total number of active cases in the city was 1,701 and the positivity rate was at 2.24%, the data showed. The city also reported 107 recoveries the same day.

156.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Sunday released
156.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 44°C or more as their maximum temperature on Sunday. Rajasthan's Bikaner recorded the highest maximum temperature at 47.1°C, followed by Ganganagar (46.9°C). Barmer recorded maximum temperature of 46.8°C. On Saturday, Maharashtra's Chandrapur had recorded the highest maximum temperature at 46.6°C.

157.title: Hyd Police change car tyres for stranded family at 1 am, share pic
157.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share a picture of police personnel helping a stranded family in the city. “HCP cops Rajesh & Narender spotted a family stranded in a car and helped them,” SHO Bowenpally wrote. The SHO also shared note by man saying the officials checked safety of his family and helped in changing tyres at 1 am.

158.title: In a bid to live with her boyfriend, woman kills husband in Bengaluru
158.article_body: Police have arrested a 27-year-old woman for allegedly killing her husband so that she could live with a man that she was in a relationship with. Police said woman made up a story about robbery attempt to cover up her husband's murder. However, her statements were found to be inconsistent. She confessed the crime when she was confronted with evidence.

159.title: Current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics: Bill Gates
159.article_body: Billionaire Bill Gates has called for the establishment of a new global pandemic surveillance unit. In an interview with the Financial Times, he said, "The current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics." Gates claimed that the WHO had fewer than "10 full-time people" preparing for future outbreaks and "even those people are distracted with many other activities".

160.title: SpiceJet flight caught in severe turbulence, 12 passengers seriously hurt
160.article_body: Around 12 passengers of a Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet flight suffered serious injuries after the plane encountered severe turbulence while landing, officials said. The plane was landed safely and injured passengers were provided immediate medical assistance, the airline said. As per reports, the injuries occurred after cabin luggage fell on passengers while some hit the food trolley.

161.title: CSK defeat SRH as Dhoni becomes oldest Indian captain to win a T20 match
161.article_body: CSK defeated SRH by 13 runs to register their third victory in IPL 2022. With the win, MS Dhoni became the oldest Indian captain to lead a side to victory in a T20 match at the age of 40 years and 298 days. Opener Ruturaj Gaikwad top-scored for CSK with 99(57) and CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary took four wickets.

162.title: Dharmendra was admitted following back pain, has been discharged now: Hospital
162.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra was hospitalised following back pain during the shoot of a film, Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital said on Sunday. The 86-year-old has now been discharged, it added. The actor was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the private hospital four days back.

163.title: I was there to bring Babri Masjid down, not Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
163.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he was in Ayodhya when Babri Masjid was razed and no Shiv Sena leader was present. "I am saying with pride that, yes, I was there to bring the structure down...No Shiv Sena leader was present there," Fadnavis said. He added, "[Shiv Sena] got scared...when they were asked to remove loudspeakers from mosques."

164.title: 1 injured in fire at Russian Defence Ministry site near Ukraine
164.article_body: Russia on Sunday reported that one person was injured in a fire at a Russian Defence Ministry facility in the southern Belgorod region bordering Ukraine. Seven homes had been damaged as a result of the incident, it added. Notably, Russia had last month accused Ukraine of carrying out a helicopter attack on a fuel depot in Belgorod.

165.title: Bored Ape NFT creator's virtual plots sell out for $285 mn of crypto
165.article_body: Bored Ape Yacht Club creator Yuga Labs raised $285 million worth of cryptocurrency by selling 55,000 virtual land plots related to its future metaverse project 'Otherside'. For each plot, it sold an NFT called 'Otherdeed' (worth $7,000), which could only be bought using the project's associated cryptocurrency ApeCoin. In total, the sold-out sale raked in 16,775,000 ApeCoin, as per Reuters.

166.title: World will hear 'Digital India Inside' instead of 'Intel Inside': MoS IT
166.article_body: Minister of State for Communications and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar, during Semicon India Conference 2022's last day, praised Centre's efforts in the semiconductor domain. "In the past, world heard Intel Inside. In the future, the world should hear Digital India Inside," he stated. He added that the government will examine the feedback it received over its Design Linked Incentive (DLI) Scheme.

167.title: He plays express pace like most do against medium: Shastri on Gaikwad's 99
167.article_body: Ravi Shastri praised Ruturaj Gaikwad following his 57-ball 99 against SRH in IPL 2022, saying there's so much to like about the CSK opener. "[He] plays express pace like most do against medium pace. He'll get there in time. No doubts. Classy stuff tonight," he tweeted. "Gaikwad in this form is such a sight to behold," tweeted Irfan Pathan.

168.title: Way above a 5% risk we haven't seen the worst of this COVID-19 pandemic: Gates
168.article_body: Bill Gates, who wrote the book 'How to Prevent the Next Pandemic', told the Financial Times, "We're still at risk of this pandemic generating a variant that would be even more transmissive and even more fatal." He added, "It's not likely...But it's way above a 5% risk that this pandemic, we haven't even seen the worst of it."

169.title: CSK record their highest partnership in IPL history
169.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on Sunday recorded their highest-ever partnership for any wicket in IPL. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway shared a 182-run opening stand against SRH to set the record. The previous record was held by Faf du Plessis and Shane Watson, who shared an unbeaten 181-run stand for opening wicket against PBKS on October 4, 2020.

170.title: T Natarajan in contention for India's T20 WC squad: Gavaskar
170.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said SRH pacer T Natarajan is in contention for a place in India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup due to his ability to bowl well in death overs. He added that yorker specialist Natarajan has shown improvement lately as he has been managing to move the ball late, which is deceiving the batters.

171.title: Heavy rain & hailstorm witnessed in Bengaluru amid a heatwave in north India
171.article_body: Amid a heatwave in northern India, many parts of Bengaluru on Sunday witnessed heavy rains and hailstorm. This came just two days after the city recorded a maximum temperature of 36.7 degrees Celsius. Areas like Frazer Town, BTM, Shivajinagar, Vijaynagar and Hosahalli received heavy rains while there were reports of trees getting uprooted.

172.title: NATO conducts military exercises in Europe amid war in Ukraine
172.article_body: Thousands of soldiers from NATO countries on Sunday took part in military exercises in Poland and eight other countries, the Polish military said. In a statement, the Polish military claimed that 18,000 soldiers from over 20 countries were taking part in Defender Europe 2022 and Swift Response 2022. The military exercises are being held amid the war in Ukraine.

173.title: LPG cylinder price hike attack on poor, labour class: Yechury
173.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised the Centre over the hike in petroleum prices and termed it an "attack on the labour class and poor". "Today, when it is Labour Day, there is a new attack on the workers. Not only on the labourers but also on the working people of the entire country," he said.

174.title: Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa calls for 'pro-people' struggle on Labour Day
174.article_body: On lnternational Labour Day, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa urged political parties to set aside differences and appealed to citizens to come together for "pro-people" struggle. "Loss of foreign exchange has created many issues. Managing all these factors is...way to solve [them]," he added. Sri Lanka is in midst of an economic crisis, fuelled by a shortage of essential resources.

175.title: Section 144 in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar from May 1-31 amid COVID-19
175.article_body: In view of a rise in COVID-19 cases and the upcoming festivals, the administration of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar has imposed section 144 of the CrPC from May 1 to 31. Offering Namaz or organising puja in public places will be banned during the period, the Police Commissionerate said. Protests or hunger strikes cannot be held without prior permission.

176.title: Happy that the bowlers pulled it back: Pant after DC's loss
176.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant said he's happy with the team's bowling performance against LSG despite losing the match by six runs at Wankhede Stadium in IPL 2022. "But on these kinds of wickets when...bowlers put up a helping hand, we got to perform as a batting unit as well," he added. Shardul Thakur took all three wickets for DC.
