Notably, Kevin Costner was introducing the director nominees when Garfield was pictured texting on his phone.

352.title: Some people giving communal colour: Tejashwi on loudspeaker row
352.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around the use of loudspeakers in religious places, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that some people are giving a "communal colour to unnecessary issues". "I want to ask a question...They (loudspeakers) were invented in 1925 and have been used in temples and mosques...since the 1970s. Didn't God exist when loudspeakers were not there?" Yadav tweeted.

353.title: Patiala clash 'mastermind' Barjinder Singh Parwana arrested from Mohali
353.article_body: Barjinder Singh Parwana, the alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Patiala, has been arrested. Range Inspector General MS Chhina said that Parwana was arrested from Mohali. A clash had broken out between members of Shiv Sena, who had called for an 'anti-Khalistan' march, and Sikh activists and Nihangs outside the Kali Mata temple.

354.title: Win means a lot, it hasn't been easy for us, we need to stick together: Ishan
354.article_body: MI opener Ishan Kishan has said their win against RR "means a lot" as it hasn't been easy for them in the ongoing IPL season. "We need to stick together...Hopefully, we win a few more matches," he added. On his 26-run innings, Ishan said, "Intent was to get boundaries in the powerplay to make it easier for the other batters."

355.title: 26-yr-old man steals 4 litres of milk from shop in Delhi, arrested
355.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing four litres of milk from a shop in Delhi's Kalkaji area on Saturday. Police said that the shopkeeper saw the man stealing four packets of milk and caught him red-handed. The shopkeeper then called the police, handed the man over and gave a written complaint.

356.title: Angelina Jolie rushes to bomb shelter in Ukraine amid air raid warning, video surfaces
356.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Angelina Jolie running towards a bomb shelter after an air raid siren went off in Ukraine's Lviv amid war with Russia. In the video, Jolie can be seen rushing out of a building with a group and saying, "I'm okay" to the camera. Earlier, she was filmed at a cafe, meeting some locals.

357.title: I was blown away by Sonali's bald look, asked Ayushmann 'Can I shave': Tahira
357.article_body: When asked what was the inspiration behind her bald look after her cancer treatment, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said she was blown away by Sonali Bendre's bald look after the latter's chemotherapy. "I was...34 when I saw that and I thought, 'What a woman'," she added. "So, when this was happening...I asked Ayushmann if I should shave," Tahira added.

358.title: 'What's the obsession with lip-syncing?' Twitter user asks Diljit, he responds
358.article_body: Singer Diljit Dosanjh responded to a Twitter user who accused him of lip-syncing during one of his performances at a concert. "What's the obsession with lip-syncing?" the user wrote while reacting to a video of Diljit performing at the Born To Shine World Tour in Jalandhar. "Lip Syncing...WTH? It's live, man. Don't disrespect the musicians," Diljit responded.

359.title: 21-yr-old rape accused jumps off Faridabad court building, dies
359.article_body: A 21-year-old man, accused of rape, jumped from the sixth floor of a court building and died in Faridabad after his bail plea hearing on Saturday. The deceased was arrested last year for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor. He had secured an interim bail later. His father claimed that the girl's parents were demanding money from him.

360.title: Karnataka man makes wife burn camphor on hand in 'fidelity test'
360.article_body: The police have launched a search for a man who allegedly forced his wife to burn camphor on her hand in a "fidelity test" in Veerenahalli village in Karnataka's Kolar. The police were informed about the matter after the head of an NGO got involved. The wife reportedly had not complained due to fear of retribution from her husband.

361.title: 18-year-old nurse found hanging from hospital wall in UP's Unnao, family allege rape
361.article_body: The body of an 18-year-old nurse was found hanging by a rope from the outer wall of a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district on Saturday. The woman's family alleged that she was gangraped and murdered and lodged an FIR naming four people including the owner of hospital, police said. Notably, the deceased had joined the hospital a day before.

362.title: Odisha announces 6-9 am teaching timings in schools amid record heat
362.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, Odisha has rescheduled the timings of teaching hours in schools. "Government after careful consideration, has been pleased to reschedule the timing of teaching hours in all schools from 6.00 am to 9.00 am wef 2nd May, 2022. However, the examination already scheduled by different Boards/Councils will continue as usual," the government notification read.

363.title: People asked us to do a lip filler, get a nose job: Singers Prakriti & Sukriti
363.article_body: Twin singers Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar said people asked them to do a lip filler and get a nose job done. "We both have typical Punjabi noses, so a lot of people used to be like maybe you should try it," the twins said. "For me, body positivity...means feeling good in your skin no matter...what shape you're in," Prakriti added.

364.title: He always carried cash in Gucci bag for no particular reason: Deb remembers Taz
364.article_body: Singer-songwriter Deb remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Saturday at the age of 54. "He was always carrying loads of cash in his Gucci sling bag for no particular reason. 'You never know; I might need it!'," Deb said, adding, "He was fighting his own battles."

365.title: It was wet all over the place, so I felt we were 10-15 runs short: Ashwin
365.article_body: After their five-wicket defeat against MI, RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said their 158-run total was 10-15 runs short as there was "heavy dew" during the second innings. "It was wet all over the place...and it makes a massive difference, good deliveries tend to get over-pitched," he added. Ashwin picked one wicket, conceding 21 runs in his four overs.

366.title: 4.5kg of Ephedrine drug worth ₹90 lakh seized at Bengaluru airport
366.article_body: A consignment of the Ephedrine drug, weighing over 4.49kg, was seized from the International Courier Terminal at the Bengaluru airport by various agencies. The drug consignment, which amounted to over ₹89.92 lakh, was hidden inside a parcel along with readymade garments and was ready to get despatched to Australia, a Customs official said. Notably, the exporter is a Vijayawada resident.

367.title: Made an original song, just used an old line: Kanika on being accused of stealing Pak song
367.article_body: After Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani accused Kanika Kapoor of copying her song 'Boohey Barian', Kanika said, "We made an original song." She added, "It's not a cover version, it's a new song completely." Kanika further said they just used a "hook line" from an old Punjabi folk song. She stated that they had no intention of stealing anybody's work.

368.title: Jos Buttler records most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player
368.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has recorded the most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player. With his 52-ball 67-run knock against MI, Buttler took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 566 in just nine matches. Buttler overtook Ajinkya Rahane, who had held the previous record with 560 runs for RR in IPL 2012.

369.title: 32-yr-old man dies as Haryana Roadways bus hits bike in Gurugram
369.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Tekchand, was killed and his colleague, Lal Mohan, was injured after a Haryana Roadways bus allegedly hit the motorcycle they were travelling on. Police said that the victims were rushed to the hospital where Tekchand was declared dead on arrival. Police said that FIR has been registered in the case.

370.title: Germany moves ICJ to deny Italy reparations for Nazi atrocities
370.article_body: Germany has registered a case in the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to stop Italy from claiming reparations over Nazi atrocities during World War II. This comes ahead of an Italian court ruling on whether to auction German-owned buildings. On several occasions in the past, Italian courts have directed Germany to pay for damages due to the Nazi atrocities.

371.title: 2nd bombing in 2 days in Afghanistan's Kabul ahead of Eid; 1 dead
371.article_body: One woman was killed and three others were injured after a bomb blast in a passenger van in Afghanistan's Kabul on Saturday, in the second incident in two days ahead of Eid al-Fitr, an official told Reuters. Earlier, over 50 worshippers were killed in a bomb blast at a mosque there. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, Reuters reported.

372.title: Viral pic of crying young woman is fake, Zelenskyy's daughter didn't escape to Poland
372.article_body: A viral photo claiming to show the 17-year-old daughter of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has "fled to Poland" is false, reported Deutsche Welle. Social media sites are falsely spreading an image of a young crying woman, claiming in various languages that Zelenskyy's daughter, Oleksandra Zelenska "hates her father" and had called him a "Nazi" and "murderer of the Ukrainian people."

373.title: Different venues are playing differently, it was tough to bowl vs MI: Samson
373.article_body: After they failed to defend their 158-run total against MI, RR captain Sanju Samson said it was tough to bowl during the second innings at the DY Patil Stadium. "We could've scored a few more runs. [Then] dew came in and it was tough to bowl...Different venues are playing in different ways. Batting first was tough...it was two-paced," he stated.

374.title: Pujara slams another double hundred in county cricket, scores 531 runs in 5 innings
374.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara smashed another double hundred for Sussex in a County Championship Division Two 2022 match against Durham. Pujara scored 203 runs off 334 deliveries in the first innings of the match. Pujara has now scored 531 runs in last five innings for Sussex. The 34-year-old batter has now smashed 15 double hundreds in first-class cricket.

375.title: 2 Bihar men caught with 150 kg marijuana in Nepal
375.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested for allegedly carrying 150 kg marijuana in Nepal's Bara district. The police said they seized the marijuana consignment consisting of 10 packets weighing 15 kg each, according to a report. The two - Ajit Paswan (35) and Ram Darshan Mahato (60) - were sent to judicial custody for further investigation by a court.

376.title: I've been working since I was 5; had no friends, childhood playful stuff: Neetu
376.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor said that she has been working since she was five years old. "So there were no friends. No childhood playful stuff at all. Then I started working with my husband [late actor Rishi Kapoor]," she said, adding that her career started with the actor and that they did 80 movies in seven years.

377.title: TN's Sri Lanka aid resolution shouldn't be for political mileage: BJP
377.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit wrote to state CM MK Stalin on Sunday saying that it welcomes the state assembly's resolution to seek permission from the Centre to provide humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka. However, it claimed that recently, the state government's actions were aimed at getting "political mileage" and it's "only afraid" this resolution shouldn't be for the same reason.

378.title: Chhattisgarh man hung upside down from tree and thrashed; 5 arrested
378.article_body: Five people were arrested after they allegedly hung a man upside down from a tree and thrashed him in Chhattisgarh. Police said accused Manish Khare, Shivraj Khare and Janu Bhargav were taken into custody on Friday while Bhim Kesarwani and 15-year-old boy were detained on Saturday. Police added Manish spotted victim trying to get into his house on April 26.

379.title: Ex-MLA PC George held for making controversial remarks against Muslims
379.article_body: Former MLA and senior Kerala politician, PC George, was taken into police custody for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims. The six-time MLA was booked under Section 153A of the IPC for allegedly making the remarks at an event organised by the Ananthapuri Hindu Maha Sammelan. The 70-year-old politician had alleged that tea sold in Muslim-run restaurants cause "impotence".

380.title: Imran Khan, 150 others booked over slogans against Pak PM in Saudi
380.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and 150 others were booked on Saturday after slogans of "chor-chor" (thief) and "gaddar" (traitor) were raised against the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif and his delegation on their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Saudi Arabia's Medina, officials said. A video of people sloganeering had surfaced online. The booked people include Khan's former cabinet members.

381.title: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder hiked by ₹102.50, will cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi
381.article_body: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50 on Sunday, reported ANI. The 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi, which was earlier priced at ₹2,253. In Mumbai, the commercial LPG price was hiked to ₹2,307 from ₹2,205 per cylinder. In Kolkata and Chennai, a 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,455 and ₹2,508 respectively.

382.title: Kohli's 58(53) was a huge step in the right direction: Du Plessis
382.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has said Virat Kohli's 58-run innings against GT was a huge step in the "right direction". He added, "Cricket is a massive game of confidence and it'll be huge. To get a solid fifty, it's big for him and for us, something that we can take forward." It was Kohli's first fifty of IPL 2022.

383.title: Getting anxiety attacks almost every day, feels like impending doom: Aamir's daughter
383.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan took to Instagram to share that she is getting anxiety attacks almost every day. Adding that it feels like "impending doom", she wrote, "It feels pretty helpless. Because I really want to go to sleep (it usually happens at night for me) but I can't because it won't stop."

384.title: Economy is in shambles, but BJP more concerned about UCC: Owaisi
384.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP on domestic economic issues. "The country's economy is in shambles, passenger trains are being cancelled to transport coal, unemployment is rising but you're more concerned about the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)," Owaisi said. "Why is the Hindu Undivided Family tax rebate not there for Muslims and Christians?" the 52-year-old politician asked.

385.title: Had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre: Rakeysh on Delhi-6 song
385.article_body: Filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra said that when they were shooting for the song 'Dil Gira Dafatan' in the movie 'Delhi-6', they did not have the same tools like today. He said they had to improvise a lot. "We had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre, with the help of Google Earth images," he added.

386.title: Govt plans to declare Delhi’s 1000-yr-old lake a national monument
386.article_body: Union Minister of State for Culture Arjun Ram Meghwal said that the government is planning to declare Delhi's Anang Tal lake, which is said to be about a thousand years old, as a national monument. During a visit to the site in South Delhi, Meghwal asked the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to expedite the restoration work of the lake.

387.title: No Muslim woman wants husband to get 3 other wives: Assam CM on UCC
387.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) isn't his issue but an "issue for all Muslim women". "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives," he added. To provide justice to Muslim women, triple talaq has to be removed and UCC needs to be brought in, he further said.

388.title: Mouni Roy recommends Astrotalk for marriage predictions
388.article_body: Mouni Roy recently collaborated with Astrotalk and praised the astrology app for serving 3 crore+ customers. She recommended people to chat with astrologers at Astrotalk to get accurate love, marriage, and career-related predictions. Astrotalk offers first chat with astrologers for free for people to try the app.

389.title: I refused a lot of male-centric, Khan or Kumar-led films: Kangana Ranaut
389.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she refused a lot of male-centric films. "[I refused many] Khan-led films or Kumar-led films [and] all kinds of big hero films," she added. When asked if she feels there is pay parity for female actors in the film industry, Kangana said, "I can say that I am not underpaid."

390.title: Big achievement: Chhavi as she visits salon at hospital after breast cancer surgery
390.article_body: Chhavi Mittal, who underwent surgery for breast cancer earlier this week, recently paid a visit to a salon at her hospital. Sharing a video of her salon visit on Saturday, she wrote, "Felt so proud of myself to walk to...salon...and sit there to get my hair washed...Big achievement." Chhavi added she also "took the most painful...but most refreshing shower today".

391.title: Anupam attends 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai's son's wedding, shares pics
391.article_body: Anupam Kher recalled being college roommates with 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai as he attended the wedding of the latter's son Nachiket. Sharing some pictures from Nachiket's wedding, Anupam wrote on Instagram that he and Anang shared a room in Delhi for three years when they attended National School of Drama. "To attend his and Chitra's son's...wedding...was pure joy," he added.

392.title: India reports 3,324 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases reach 19,092
392.article_body: India has reported 3,324 COVID-19 cases, 2,876 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 50 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,092, while the death toll rose to 5,23,843.

393.title: Madras High Court declares Mother Nature as a 'Living Being'
393.article_body: Madras High Court has used the "parens patriae jurisdiction" to declare Mother Nature as a 'Living Being', with all the rights, duties and liabilities of a living person, to help conserve and preserve it. Indiscriminate destruction of nature will cause several complications in ecosystem, the court observed. The court also directed the state and central government to protect Mother Nature.

394.title: Ashwin's wife consoles Rohit's wife after spinner dismisses MI captain, video goes viral
394.article_body: RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's wife Prithi consoled MI captain Rohit Sharma's wife Ritika after Ashwin dismissed Rohit in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. Rohit was dismissed by the spinner for two runs off five deliveries in the third over of MI's innings. MI, however, went on to win the match by five wickets.

395.title: Lord Ram had bow, Yogi Adityanath has bulldozer: Sakshi Maharaj
395.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Sakshi Maharaj said, "While Lord Ram and Krishna had 'dhanush' (bow) and 'sudarshan chakra' respectively, our baba (Yogi Adityanath) has a bulldozer, which is being used against land mafia." Meanwhile, talking about leaders of opposition parties visiting Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan in Sitapur jail, he said, "I'm keeping an eye on it...and government...is aware of it."

396.title: Directors I worked with wanted short & sexy clothes for heroines: Manish Malhotra
396.article_body: Speaking about his journey in Bollywood, designer Manish Malhotra said he "really came into the limelight" after working with director Ram Gopal Varma on 'Rangeela'. Manish revealed that such types of clothes became a trend after he designed Urmila Matondkar's clothes in 'Rangeela'. He added the directors he was working with wanted clothes that were glamorous, sexy and short.

397.title: Scrap godown in Hyderabad catches fire, no casualties reported
397.article_body: A godown of scrap goods in Hyderabad's Musheerabad area caught fire on Saturday. Three fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the incident was reported by the locals at around 8 pm. According to the officials, no casualties have been reported yet and it is suspected that a short circuit could be the cause of the fire accident.

398.title: K'taka institute announces free education for kids of Kashmiri Pandits
398.article_body: Convener of Ambika Mahavidyalaya in Karnataka has announced free education for children of Kashmiri Pandits. "It will cost up to Rs 80,000 per student for a year to get education in this institute. The other facilities would cost them Rs 50,000 annually. But all facilities would be freely available to the children of Kashmiri Pandits," he added.

399.title: Burden is off Jadeja's shoulders: Ajay Jadeja on Dhoni returning as CSK captain
399.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja will be relieved after handing over the CSK captaincy back to MS Dhoni. He added, "If Dhoni is in the team, he must be the captain. Everyone is happy...the burden is off [Jadeja's] shoulders now." CSK lost six of their first eight matches in IPL 2022 under Ravindra Jadeja.

400.title: There was romance in films, husband was not comfortable with it: Bhagyashree
400.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that her husband Himalay Dassani was not comfortable with her getting involved in films because they had romance in it. "The kind of films that were being made and having a very possessive husband, it gave a lesser spectrum of films that I could have worked on without him," she added.

401.title: Pune won't face water cuts as monsoon expected on time: PMC
401.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation said that the city won't face any water supply cuts as there is sufficient stock in four dams and monsoon is expected to arrive on time. The water stock in four dams - Panshet, Warasgaon, Khadakwasla and Temghar - was at 36% capacity on Saturday. The stock is adequate for the next one month, said an official.

402.title: Man poses as govt officer, cheats woman of ₹89 lakh in Bengaluru
402.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Bengaluru after he allegedly cheated a woman of ₹89 lakh by posing as an Intelligence Bureau officer. The man had told the woman that her passport was on a blacklist and that she'd been booked for "suspected terrorist activities act", according to police. The accused had reportedly promised to help her clear her name.

403.title: Man confronts girlfriend over affair, his friend gets killed in Pune
403.article_body: A 21-year-old man, Ganesh Ravindra Gaikwad, was stabbed to death after he accompanied his friend, Rahul Valanj, who wanted to confront his alleged girlfriend over suspicion of an affair in Pune. The girl called her uncle when Valanj confronted her at the shop where she worked. The uncle came with a few men and stabbed Gaikwad during a violent fight.

404.title: Our real potential came out against RR: Rohit on 1st win of IPL 2022
404.article_body: After MI defeated RR by five wickets to register their first win of the ongoing IPL season, captain Rohit Sharma said their "real potential" came out in the match. He added, "We were [also] not blown away by the opposition [in the previous games], we came really close. Had we won those games, things would have been slightly different."
